comment.body: I tested on a dedicated server (Intel Xeon) : I only get "Insane !!" and "WOW" haha :D (5.18s)
I try to update with update.py, but I'm still at rev 915 :(

> [erkan](#comment_70_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @angristanI am not sure which version (1)you are running, but I am using the one from master branch on github, that is the "hottest stuff", which also might break one day, if I am unlucky ;-)
> normally you should be able to update also from the UI from (2): click on the 3 dots on the lft upper corner and then on the version number you have there.
> BTW: we are already at rev1059, @nofish is busy today
> (1) ZeroBundle, something from windows, ....(2) http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/?Home

I am using ZeroBundle for Windows, and when I try to update from the UI, it asks me to update to the dev version ^^

> [erkan](#comment_71_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): I see, I guess then your revision 915 is the newest as stable version.
> If you want to upgrade you have to decide yourself.You can check out the commits here: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commits/master

Done ! Rev 1062. Thx erkan
